data.title: The Evaluation of Medical Expert Systems
data.meta_description: Papers discussing the evaluation of medical expert systems are spread widely among artificial intelligence, statistics, medical informatics and clinical journals (e.g., Shortliffe & Davis 1975; Spiegelhalter 1983; Chandrasekaran 1983; Gaschnig et al. 1983; Wasson...
data.text:
Adams D., Chan M., Clifford P.C., et al. (1986). Computer aided diagnosis of acute abdominal pain: A multicentre study.British Medical Journal,293, 800–804.

Bachant J. & McDermott J. (1984). R1 revisited: Four years in the trenches. AI Magazine, 5 (Fall 1984), 21–32.

Brahams D. & Wyatt J. (1989). Decision-aids and the law.Lancet,2, 632–634.

Buck C. & Donner A. (1982). The design of controlled experiments in the evaluation of non-therapeutic interventions.J Chron Dis,35, 531–538.

Chandrasekeran B. (1983). On evaluating AI systems for medical diagnosis.AI Magazine,4, 34–37.

Clancey W.J. (1989). Viewing knowledge bases as qualitative models.IEEE Expert (Summer 1989), 9–23.

Cohen P. & Howe A. (1988). How evaluation guides AI research. AI Magazine, 9 (Winter 1988), 35–43.

Colby K.M., Hilf F.D., Weber S., & Kramer H.C. (1972). Turing-like indistinguishability tests for the validation of computer simulation of paranoid processes.AI Journal,3, 199–221.

Console L., Molino G., Pavia R., Signorelli M., & Torasso P. (1989). Simulating generic situations on causal models. In Hunter J., Cookson J. & Wyatt J. (eds.).Proc AIME 1989Heidelberg: Springer Verlag, 177–186.

Donabedian A. (1978). The quality of medical care.Science 200, 856–864.

Emerson P., Russell N., Wyatt J., et al. (1989). An audit of doctors’ management of patients with chest pain in the accident and emergency department.Q J Med,70, 213–220.

Gaschnig J., Klahr P., Pople H., Shortliffe E., Terry A. (1983). Evaluation of expert systems: Issues and case studies. In Hayes-Roth F., Waterman D.A., & Lenat D. (eds.), Building Expert Systems. Addison-Wesley.

Glymour C. (1989). When less is more. In Evans D.A. Patel V.L. (eds.),Cognitive Science in MedicineCambridge, MA: MIT Press, 349–371.

Gough M. & Bell J. (1989). Introducing aptitude testing into medicine.British Medical Journal,298, 975–976.

Hammersley J.R. & Cooney K. (1988). Evaluating the utility of available differential diagnosis systems. In Greenes R.A. (ed.),Proc. 12th Symposium on Computer Applications in Medical Care(SCAMC), Washington, DC: IEEE.

Hart A. & Wyatt J. (1990). Evaluating black boxes as medical decision-aids: Issues arising from a case study of neural networks.Medical Informatics 1990,15, 229–236.

Heckerman D. & Horwitz E. (1988). The myth of modularity in rule-based systems for reasoning with uncertainty. In Lemmer J., Kanal L. (eds.),Uncertainty in AI,2North Holland: Elsevier Science.

Hilden J. & Habbema D.F. (1990). Evaluation of clinical decision-aids: More to think about.Medical Informatics,15, 275–284.

Indurkhya N. & Weiss S.M. (1989). Models for measuring performance of medical expert systems.AI in Medicine 1989,1, 61–70.

Kors J.A., van Bemmel J.H. (1989). The Delphi method: A review of its applications in medicine. In Barber B., Cao D., Qin D., Wagner G. (eds.), Proceedings Medlnfo 1989, Amsterdam: North Holland, 156–160.

Long W.J. (1991). Flexible reasoning about patient management using multiple models.AI in Medicine 1991,3, 3–20.

Lundsgaarde H.P. (1987). Evaluating medical expert systems.Social Science in Medicine,24, 805–819.

Miller P.L. (1986). The evaluation of artificial intelligence systems in medicine. Comp. Meth. and Frog. in Biomedicine, 22, 5–11.

Miller P.L. (1988). Evaluating medical expert systems. In Miller P.L. (ed.),Selected Topics in Medical AINew York: Springer.

Miller P.L. & Sittig D.F. (1990). The evaluation of clinical decision support systems: What is necessary versus what is interesting.Medical Informatics 1990,15, 185–190.

Nguyen T., Perkins W., Laffey T., & Pecora D. (1987). Knowledge base verification.AI Magazine,8 (Summer 1987), 69–75.

Nykanen P. (ed.) (1989). Issues in the evaluation of computer-based support to clinical decision making.Report of SYDPOL WG5Denmark: SYDPOL, 1989.

O’Neil M., Glowinski A., Fox J. (1989). A symbolic theory of decision-making applied to several medical tasks. In Hunter J., Cookson J., & Wyatt J. (eds.), Proceedings AIME 1989Heidelberg: Springer Verlag, 62–71.

Patel V.L., Evans D.A., & Kaufman D.R. (1989). A cognitive framework for doctor-patient interaction. In Evans D.A., Patel V.L. (eds.),Cognitive Science in MedicineCambridge, MA: MIT Press, 257–312.

Quaglini S., Stefanelli M., Barosi G., & Berzuini A. (1987). A performance evaluation of the expert system ANAEMIA.Comp Biomed Rea,21, 307–323.

Reggia J.A. (1988). Evaluation of medical expert systems: Case study in performance assessment. In Miller P.L. (ed.),Selected Topics in Medical AINew York: Springer, 222–230.

Roethligsburger F. & Dickson W. (1939). Management andthe WorkerCambridge, MA: Harvard Univ. Press.

Schmitz P.I.M., Habbema J.D.F., & Hermans J. (1983). The performance of logistic discrimination on myocardial infarction data, in comparison with some other discriminant analysis methods.Statistics in Medicine,2, 199–205.

Shortliffe E.H., Davis R. (1975). Some considerations for the implementation of knowledge-based expert systems. SIGART Newsletter 55, December 1975, 9–12.

Shortliffe E.H. (1987). Computer programs to support medical decisions. Journalof the Amererican Medical Association,258, 61–66.

Shwe M., Tu S., & Fagan L. (1989). Validating the knowledge base of a therapy planning system.Meth Inf Med 1989,28, 36–50.

Spiegelhalter D.J. (1983). Evaluation of medical decision-aids, with an application to a system for dyspepsia.Statistics in Medicine,2, 207–216.

Suwa M., Scott A.C., & Shortliffe E.H. (1984). Completeness and consistency in a rule-based system. In Buchanan B.G. & Shortliffe E.H. (eds.),Rule-Based Expert SystemsReading, MA: Addison-Wesley, 159–170.

Swets J.A. (1988). Measuring the accuracy of diagnostic systems.Science 240, 1285–1293.

Turing A. (1950). Computing machinery and intelligence.Mind,59, 236–248.

Van Way C.W., Murphy J.R., Dunn E.L., Elerdipg S.C. (1982). A feasibility study of computer-aided diagnosis in appendicitis. Surgery Gyn and Obs, 155, 685–688.

Wasson J.H., Sox H.C., Neff R.K., & Goldman L. (1985). Clinical prediction rules: Applications and methodological standards.New England Journal of Medicine,313, 793–799.

Willems J.L., Abreu-Lima C., Arnaud P., et al. (1987). Testing the performance of ECG computer programs: The CSE diagnostic pilot study.J Electrocardiol (1987), supplement, 73–77.

Wyatt J., Dillistone J., & Emerson P.A. (1988). Thrombolysis in acute MI: Why the delay? Brit. Heart J., 59, 618.

Wyatt J. (1989). Lessons learned from the field trial of ACORN, a chest pain advisor. In Barber B., Cao D., Qin D., & Wagner G. (eds.),Proc. Medlnfo 1989North Holland: Elsevier Scientific, 111–115.

Wyatt J., Spiegelhalter D. (1990). Evaluating medical expert systems. Medical Informatics 1990, 15, 205–217.

Wyatt J. & Spiegelhalter D. (1991). Field trials of medical decision-aids: Potential problems and solutions. In Clayton P.D. (ed.),Proc. 15th Symposium on Computer Applications in Medical Care (SCAMC), New York, NY: McGraw-Hill, Inc., 1991, 3–7.
